chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Barry Melvin La Ronge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.

DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge. If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: 30 days conditional jail.  44 days credit.  Remainder of credit will be applied if Revoked.

records.addlTxt:
10:54 AM Defendant Barry Melvin La Ronge in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Barry Melvin La Ronge.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.   State recites agreement, All parties agree.  Court reviews information, DEF enters Guilty plea to Count 1.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea to Count 1 and finds DEF guilty.   Count 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.   State makes statement prior to sentencing.  Attny Chapman makes statement prior to sentencing.   DEF makes statement to court.  

COURT;  withheld sentence:  3 years probation:  Condition of Probation:  30 days conditional jail,  44 days credit, Remainder of credit will be applied if Revoked.    Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.   Fine//Costs  $1079.25  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.

10:13 AM Defendant Barry Melvin La Ronge in court. Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Barry Melvin La Ronge.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Chapman  acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:39 AM Defendant Barry Melvin La Ronge appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Chapman indicates DEF waives preliminary hearing  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.

8:37 AM Defendant Barry Melvin La Ronge appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Court enters NG Plea to Counts 2 and 3.  DEF waives preliminary hearing.  Bond Continues.
Arraignment scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:03 AM  Defendant Barry LaRonge in court, in custody appears by video.  Attny Christian Ness (special appearance) appear by video in court.  Kenneth Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Probable Cause found by court. DE does qualify for PD appointment.   State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Ness no objection.   Court sets bond.  SIBS $2500 ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.    INITIAL APPEARANCE set for  May 3, 2022  @ 8:30 AM
